author: neery1218
content: might have missed this in the paper, but is there anything stopping a miner from only including 1 transaction in a block (ie well under the block gas limit) to try and produce as many valid blocks as fast as possible and collect block rewards?

author: ajsutton
content:
Nothing stopping it and they don't even need to include one transaction, but leaving out transactions won't help them solve PoW any faster.  They'd just be leaving money on the table by not collecting the inclusion fees from transactions.

You do see empty blocks turn up fairly regularly which is when by chance the miner finds the PoW solution before they've finished processing transactions to add to the block.  There's no reason for them to not just publish it.  But as soon as they can they get transactions included and try to find the PoW solution for a full block because that earns them more.

author: neery1218
content:
> but leaving out transactions won't help them solve PoW any faster
hmm i don't understand this part. my understanding was that you can only start solving for the PoW solution _after_ processing the transactions and creating the new block header. hence processing less transactions => start solving PoW faster => create block faster. 

are you saying that the time to process transactions <<< solving PoW? so the extra time gained by leaving out transactions is inconsequential

author: treyzania
content: that's correct

author: treyzania
content: and it's depending on the setup it's actually not uncommon for empty blocks to be mined if a miner gets lucky in the very small amount of time it takes between getting a block over the network and when they've fully validated it

author: treyzania
content: they just mine an empty block on top of the previous block if the pow checks out

author: ajsutton
content: Miners may wind up creating multiple blocks they try and find the PoW solution for - first an empty one which is as quick as possible to create, then one filled with the available transactions but if a higher paying transaction comes along before they've found the PoW solution they may create a different block again to include that.
